title: Is it better to be a Jungler or an ADC?
body:
Title

Seem these are the role that has the most spotlight in solo Q

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=lumanachi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rwVYA9gV,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-04-02T14:38:02.830+0000)
>
> Title
> 
> Seem these are the role that has the most spotlight in solo Q

**I FIND IT EXTREMELY FUNNY THAT ANYBODY WHO SAID JUNGLE GOT DOWNVOTED**

The fucking ADC hate is so real on these boards.

To answer your question, The silver and bronze players are going to tell you ADC is better if you want the spotlight role.

The good players that dont come to these boards are going to tell you that Jungler is better. 

ADCs will find themself relying on their team more often than not for engages team fights peel and objectives. As a Jungler you are the shot caller, you are the person that snowballs lanes, you are the engage most of the time.

The better Jungler wins in this meta.

Wtf? Jungle is most likely one of the harder roles to climb. You are so dependent on your team like no other role. Your team dies to enemy jungler? -> You are now behind and contestint objectives is harder. Your team goes doesn't give you the setups for ganks? -> You need to farm and counterjungle, combining this with your team dies to enemy jungler you are now completly fucked.

> [{quoted}](name=Hügö,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rwVYA9gV,comment-id=000b0002,timestamp=2018-04-03T17:21:50.592+0000)
>
> Wtf? Jungle is most likely one of the harder roles to climb. You are so dependent on your team like no other role. 

Pretty sure ADC is the most dependent on your team like no other role. In which case your argument is invalid because it applies to ''both'' .

>Your team dies to enemy jungler? -> You are now behind and contestint objectives is harder.

Your top laner dies to enemy top laner? You are now behind as an ADC

> Your team goes doesn't give you the setups for ganks? 

ADCs cant gank at all or engage like Junglers can so again, your argument here is invalid because it applies to both in your situation.

>-> You need to farm

Every role needs to farm..

> and counterjungle,

ADCs need to worry about enemy support, getting ganked and farming. Again your argument is invalid.

Not even close dude. As an adc you have an actual laning phase where you can farm and kill an enemy depending on your skill. Same goes for point 2 and 3. 4 is taken completly out of context from you so thers nothing to say. And the last point has nothing to do with each other.
You argumentation is very weak or, which I think is the harder issue is your lack of understanding the game as a plat 4 player.

> [{quoted}](name=Hügö,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rwVYA9gV,comment-id=000b000200000000,timestamp=2018-04-03T18:31:53.854+0000)
>
> Not even close dude. As an adc you have an actual laning phase where you can farm and kill an enemy depending on your skill. Same goes for point 2 and 3. 4 is taken completly out of context from you so thers nothing to say. And the last point has nothing to do with each other.
> You argumentation is very weak or, which I think is the harder issue is your lack of understanding the game as a plat 4 player.

Its really hard when a silver 5 player who has never experienced bot lane **is telling you about your lane**
Oh man now you showed me I guess. If I only had a bit of knowledge of the game, but i guess you are so much better then me.

> [{quoted}](name=Kovorix,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rwVYA9gV,comment-id=000b00020000000000000000,timestamp=2018-04-04T15:56:10.903+0000)
>
> Oh man now you showed me I guess. If I only had a bit of knowledge of the game, but i guess you are so much better then me.

Because you're opinion is based off nothing but inexperience.. You are actually trolling if you say jungler has less presence or spotlight than adc. Junglers determine the game right now. Of course the 8-0 Xayah will ravage through people.

Funny that you tell me im inexpierienced when there is a safe evidence that i have more knowledge about the game then you. But I guess you just can't accept that you are not right so there is no reason to argue more with you.

> [{quoted}](name=Hópe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rwVYA9gV,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2018-04-02T18:46:51.880+0000)
>
> **I FIND IT EXTREMELY FUNNY THAT ANYBODY WHO SAID JUNGLE GOT DOWNVOTED**
> 
> The fucking ADC hate is so real on these boards.

Literally the only downvoted comment says ADC. Literally ever regions top 50 challenger rankings are flooded with ADC mains and JG is borderline nonexistent at the top of the ladder. IF the game was balanced like it was a year ago sure JG and Mid are the best roles to climb with because they can influence the most other roles. But the games not balanced and ADC are the only role that actually matter is close games

> [{quoted}](name=BestPudgeNA,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rwVYA9gV,comment-id=000b0001,timestamp=2018-04-03T00:51:54.951+0000)
>
> Literally the only downvoted comment says ADC.

Its almost as if upvotes and downvotes are different a day later

> Literally ever regions top 50 challenger rankings are flooded with ADC mains 

If you check the top 30 for NA there is actually a lot of support mains and top mains in there.

>and JG is borderline nonexistent at the top of the ladder. 

We arent talking about challenger. The guys asking what **he** should play for spotlight. From Bronze to Diamond Jungler is the spotlight. Thats not an opinion im sorry.

>IF the game was balanced like it was a year ago sure JG and Mid are the best roles to climb with because they can influence the most other roles. But the games not balanced and ADC are the only role that actually matter is close games

You should main ADC and climb out of silver 4 then.

> [{quoted}](name=Hópe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rwVYA9gV,comment-id=000b00010001,timestamp=2018-04-03T14:06:19.123+0000)
>
> Its almost as if upvotes and downvotes are different a day later

It's almost like the boards aren't biased against ADCs.

> If you check the top 30 for NA there is actually a lot of support mains and top mains in there.

8 Mids 8 ADCs 7 Top 5 JG 2 sups  in the top 30 NA right now, why you lying?

> You should main ADC and climb out of silver 4 then.

ADC is boring why would i want to do that. Ranked isn't fun JG has very little agency. You see my WR on champs i actually play to win all 60% i could climb to at least gold/plat if i wanted to. It's just not fun.

60% at Silver 4 doesn’t mean gold/Plat, it means like Silver 2 my dude. 

If you were actually had Plat levels of play you’d physically have a hard time staying at Silver 4 without actively trolling.

> [{quoted}](name=Disembark,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rwVYA9gV,comment-id=000b0001000100000001,timestamp=2018-04-03T18:11:51.162+0000)
>
> 60% at Silver 4 doesn’t mean gold/Plat, it means like Silver 2 my dude. 
> 
> If you were actually had Plat levels of play you’d physically have a hard time staying at Silver 4 without actively trolling.

My secondary account that i q top/mid on is gold 3 with still a 60% win rate over 20 games muh dude.  The main account started the season Bronze 3 because i never really played ranked last season, had Silver 5 MMR from playing shit like Blitz JG, Lethality WW and Full AP mao. Then during placements had 3 games with leavers in my placements. I'm not stuck S4 i'm S4 and climbing quick just have only played like 5 ranked games n the past month because i have no desire to climb.

> [{quoted}](name=BestPudgeNA,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rwVYA9gV,comment-id=000b0001,timestamp=2018-04-03T00:51:54.951+0000)
>
> Literally the only downvoted comment says ADC. Literally ever regions top 50 challenger rankings are flooded with ADC mains and JG is borderline nonexistent at the top of the ladder. IF the game was balanced like it was a year ago sure JG and Mid are the best roles to climb with because they can influence the most other roles. But the games not balanced and ADC are the only role that actually matter is close games

I think it was like that before reason showed up on that thread.

Total upvotes/downvotes change rather quickly, you see.
Not across a whole post.
i actually cannot play any ADC other than lucian and vayne in gold because people are just so unreliable
I guess that's true.  I voted jungle, but didn't consider the 'elo variances'.  I'd guess that adc is more powerful the lower you are nowadays.

(Support... do it...)

I guess I’d recommend jg. Adc’s make a big impact but they don’t get to make many macro decisions to impact the game. It’s kind of like being a gun that your team carries around and points at the enemy.

Supports carry so hard rn.  "adcs win games!" Lol. no, not at all.  If an adc carries, he got carried by his support.  Unfortunately I'm not that hot of a support.  People really undershoot how difficult that role is.  It might not require a shit load of mechanics, but the amount of macro, decisions, why's and when's of that role is overwhelming.
so i'm gonna agree with you that supports carry hard. The role really isn't any more difficult than any other role though. and then there's {{champion:117}} ...

It's not more difficult than any other role.  I agree.  I often see people pretending that is easier than other roles, though.  I could be dumb, but I don't agree with that.  Support is just as "easy" as any other role.

I mean adc's can for sure carry a game with good mechanics, cs'ing, and making safe map rotations, all of which are actually pretty hard to do; but they are so fragile they are usually require the team to set up those situations.

But yeah, anyone who thinks support is as easy as protecting only the adc and dropping ward anywhere does not know how to proactively carry with the role.

If they have a good team, sure. An adc is nothing without a team. Lol. I was a d2 adc main who recently switched to mid/jung bc I'm salty that adcs are only as good as their team allows them to be. Lol.

{{champion:145}} 

Why not both?

why not {{champion:29}} {{champion:203}} {{champion:145}}  both?

that way, you don't have to deal with braindead supports.

I wanted to quit playing adcs so many times just cause of a braindead supp,getting a good one is the best thing ever but i always seem to find that one thresh that missess all his spells and then still goes to engage while im at half hp and he dies pinging

You would still have to deal with your braindead bot lane who does not help with dragon though. 
And your braindead mid laner who brings the entire team into your rift herald attempt. 
And your braindead top laner who goes 0/8/0 because he's playing in the longest lane, without wards, and pushing up. Then he proceeds to flame you into oblivion for not helping. 

ADCs must deal with braindead supports
Supports must deal with braindead ADCs
Junglers must deal with braindead teams. Lol
If you want to climb, it's objectively jungler.

Depends. 

Jungler, more early game impact and can snowball easily if done correctly and objective control. 

ADC, more so farming for items and waiting for a 5v5.

JG can have the biggest impact on a game. If a jg gets a couple lanes fed or very far ahead the game is over if they use their advantages correctly.
While if you are an ADC....if your support is bad or you are countered hard in lane you are screwed without jg help.

I love being a jungler. Being big daddy lets me help out the bronzoids that feed in my games and give me a sense of control, when otherwise I'd be stuck in a lane and hope my jungler has the agency and sense of mind to help out the other lanes and secure objectives.

I'm usually left disappointed, and my personal motto is to never expect things of others if I can't do them myself, so I jungle for those who can't.

edit: if you're gonna ADC, make sure you can get CS and capitalize on every opportunity with your support or jungler, or you can't do yer jerb and carry.
Junglers. Hands down. Dragons are so important. Rift Herald can get you an inhib at 15 minutes. I've done it. Several times.

A good jungler is more of an asset than a good ADC; a good jungler will get 2 lanes ahead, a good ADC will be camped by the enemy jungler and very possibly their midlaner. Also, a jungler ultimately relies on no one; as someone who sometimes plays ADC, getting a non-functional support can cripple you if both enemy laners are competent, not to mention the enemy roamers....

On a trend basis- Jungle is the role that allows the highest skilled players to climb the most quickly. ADCs have to go against coordinated, duoQ'd botlanes so it's no contest.

If you're making a personal choice-- if your MACRO is good, go jungle. It's a rarer skill and it's wasted playing ADC.

Out of these two, jungle.  I used to a D2 adc, main but last season I just could not climb.  Regardless to popular belief, adcs hold very little agency over the game right now.  If the adc carries, it's because his support did everything in their power to keep them alive, and because his jungler sat bot.  I got tired of dominating lane as adc to lose games.  I was frustrated because I was stuck in plat and couldn't climb as my best role - adc.  I switched to jungle/mid and shot up to diamond real fast. Lol.

It generally depends on your preferences. If you have really good mechanics and laning skills, then adc is better. But if you have really good map awareness and macro knowledge, then jungle is better.

Realistically, jungle is better for climbing in almost every meta since you get to freely impact whatever lanes you want to and get your whole team ahead, rather than just yourself.

For example, winning a 1v1 fight does not benefit your team as much as winning a 2v1 fight/gank does, with assist gold and spreading the rewards.

Jungle obviously, with things like Jaz you can have great dmg along with tankiness and he is a great carry too, you can effectively win other lanes by helping them. Jungle is a extremely impactful roles,the thing is at a certain point the adc shines more then the jungle, that is  when teamfights happen which is why you need a feed  adc at that point. Jungles win early game and adc win late game, but because games are shorter adc end up having alot more impact, that being said jungles still are the best in solo q, a good jungle wins games.

The one problem i have is sometimes the guy is just bad so focus other lanes. That being said only do this if your lanes gets solo killed after you already successfully ganked them and helped kill them but the still lose 1v1.

> [{quoted}](name=Shablagoo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rwVYA9gV,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2018-04-02T18:10:47.064+0000)
>
> Jungle obviously, with things like Jaz you can have great dmg along with tankiness and he is a great carry too, you can effectively win other lanes by helping them. Jungle is a extremely impactful roles,the thing is at a certain point the adc shines more then the jungle, that is  when teamfights happen which is why you need a feed  adc at that point. Jungles win early game and adc win late game, but because games are shorter adc end up having alot more impact, that being said jungles still are the best in solo q, a good jungle wins games.
> 
> The one problem i have is sometimes the guy is just bad so focus other lanes. That being said only do this if your lanes gets solo killed after you already successfully ganked them and helped kill them but the still lose 1v1.

The problem with that is in lower elo's though.  Kids don't understand the concept of "if you lost your lane HARD, the jungler shouldn't be helping you more".

I can't tell you how many times in the first 5 mins of the game my bot lane gives up 3 kills.  Double kills right away and then a solo kill of a jungler trying to clean up.  Now they have 3 kills on you and most likely an early BF and your lane is gonna be screwed.  The Jungler should start ganking mid or top our counter jungling.  But again, Plat and lower elo don't understand that.  They think they should be babysitted all game.
Ya they always expect me to gank, and end up blaming me for them losing
If you are looking to melee ad carry, and picking blind, it is way better to be jungle.  But that isn't exactly meta.

Right now I'd say jungle simply for the fact that games are decided very early and usually the jungler has the most saying on how it goes.
As an ADC you have very little agency on how the early game goes, unless the enemy botlane is so bad that you can kill them over and over. You're also very reliant on someone else during the laning phase.
As jungle you have many more options to make sure your team can snowball.
Find a midlane duo and just 4 man gank botlane all the time and claim your free elo.

after plat, you can have more impact as an ADC. if you're below plat and only marginally better than your enemies, then your best bet is jungling or a solo lane (preferably a champion that can both damage turrets and wave clear)

Jungler can win bot top and mid.

Bot lane can win bot and carry game.

Jungling doesnt take long to get good at.

Bot lane requires a bit more than jungling.

Both are pretty much the same, but adc requires more skill.

A jungler has the most control over the map if that's your thing. It really depends on your playstyle. Out of all the roles, it scales the hardest with game knowledge and an objective-oriented mindset. Requires a thick skin to main jungling, as it has the most responsibility, which often leads to taking the blame when things go wrong.

ADC arguably takes the most mechanical effort, but basically adheres to rock-paper-scissors when it comes to team comps/match-making, largely due to their lack of self-sufficiency compared to other roles. Requires patience, as you are squishy as hell, and a lot of what goes on will be out of your control for most of the game.

Basically, jungling and bot-laning are near polar opposites with how they approach the game.

Jungle is a trash role that has no impact on the game. I'm sure other people tell you otherwise, but you're just meaningless after the first 5 mins of the game. Your job is basically to get your lanes a small lead and then hope they don't int their faces off while you provide nothing in team fights. 

ADC is the god role right now after 15 mins nothing else matters at all, if you play better then the other ADC you will win. Period end of story.

> [{quoted}](name=BestPudgeNA,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rwVYA9gV,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-04-02T16:37:51.993+0000)
>
> Jungle is a trash role that has no impact on the game. I'm sure other people tell you otherwise, but you're just meaningless after the first 5 mins of the game. Your job is basically to get your lanes a small lead and then hope they don't int their faces off while you provide nothing in team fights. 
> 
> ADC is the god role right now after 15 mins nothing else matters at all, if you play better then the other ADC you will win. Period end of story.

thats so biased an full of shit that i honestly hope you are trolling.

> [{quoted}](name=Its All Skillzz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rwVYA9gV,comment-id=00050001,timestamp=2018-04-03T21:35:19.311+0000)
>
> thats so biased an full of shit that i honestly hope you are trolling.

You got me man, i'm just trolling. It's really fun to play {{champion:77}} go 10/2/10 and lose because your ADC wants to play frontline and you can't win teamfights because of it.
jungler for sure.  As adc you don't actually have much agency over the first 10 minutes of the game.
I think it’s situational, really. Could go either way.
